thread.site_title: Syracuse NY Local News, Breaking News, Sports & Weather
thread.title: Man wanted in Manlius shooting killed his nephew after argument, police said
thread.title_full: Man wanted in Manlius shooting killed his nephew after argument, police said

author: Timia Cobb | tcobb@syracuse.com
title: Man wanted in Manlius shooting killed his nephew after argument, police said
text:
Manlius, N.Y. — A man shot his own nephew in a fatal shooting in the village of Manlius this weekend, police said Wednesday.
Police are still looking for the uncle, Radu Turner, 48, of Manlius. He’s wanted in the killing of Kenquan Davis, 39, of Syracuse.
On Wednesday, Manlius police announced they have obtained an arrest warrant for Turner for second-degree murder and second-degree criminal possession of a weapon.
Police also made public that the two men were related.
At about 4 p.m. Sunday, Turner was involved in a verbal altercation with Davis in front of Turner’s home at 205 Elmbrook Drive.
As the argument escalated, Davis attempted to drive away in a car when he was shot, causing him to crash into a nearby tree on Garrett Drive, said Manlius Police Capt. Tina Stanton
Turner is described by police as 6 feet tall and between 160 and 180 pounds.
Turner was last seen driving a gray Jeep Grand Cherokee with the New York license plate LHX-5697. On Monday night, the same Jeep was found in front of a Salina apartment complex, Harborside Manor at 24 Town Garden Drive.
Turner has done two stints in state prison, court records show.
He pleaded guilty in 2001 to a drug charge and was sentenced to two to four years in prison. He pleaded guilty in 2017 to a pair of weapons and drug charges and was sentenced to three-and-a-half years in prison.
Police ask anyone with information regarding the whereabouts of Turner not to approach him but instead to call 911.
Syracuse.com staff writer Timia Cobb covers breaking news. Have a tip, a story idea, a question or a comment? You can reach her at tcobb@syracuse.com.
